answers.answer: They are telling you to come in cause it could be preclamsia.
I think they're telling to watch for the difficulty breathing due to the possibility of a blood clot. I'd go in, that's nothing to mess with. Rather be safe than sorry! Good luck
Yes if It is warm to the touch and any pain. Could be a blood clot

Oh my! Some of the swelling has gone down..but it's still pretty swollen. It doesn't hurt though. My husband wants me to try to stick it out until the morning to see if it's still swollen. Is this a bad idea? Cause it sounds like it

I'd go straight in... Not only could it be a blood clot but pre eclampsia which is harmful to you and baby. I wouldn't risk anything especially considering how close you are to having your little one!
I'm at the ER now! Thank you mamas! Wish us luck >< hopefully it's just my body not being used to being so heavy
Could be preeclampsia. Keep us updated
As a nurse I'm so happy you went to the ER could be preeclampsia or blood clot both are serious and potentially life threatening, hope all is well.
Omg I totally forgot about this! It turned out to be nothing other than insane pregnant weight on my frame! But I'm glad I took yalls advice and went to the ER cause it was really scary♡

question: So I have my left leg that's like the elephant man, and the right leg is just mildly swollen.Now when I say swollen, I mean SWOLLEN! No ankle, chubby toes, even my calf is swollen.I called my nurse hotline and they said I need to see urgent care in the next 4 hours? But so far I've been icing it, keeping my feet elevated, drinking water, and my husband massaged my legsThey told me to be on the look out for respiratory problems but I always feel like I have a tough time breathing... especially since I'm at 39 weeks
title: only one leg swollen?
